entry.title: Speeding up Firefox CSS3 transform transitions with rotate(0.01deg)
entry.content:
I’m working on a heavily animated, mobile-accessible kids’ website and was getting some exceptionally slow performance from Firefox during supposedly GPU-accelerated CSS3 transitions.

Turns out there’s a bug, still unaddressed, that lubricates Gecko with jank molasses anytime it has to animate a transition involving the scale() property. The solution? Add a dash of rotate(0.01deg) to your transform property and the problem magically goes aways. So if you’d like to set -moz-transform to scale(2), set it to scale(2) rotate(0.01deg) and you won’t have any problems.
